items.title: A hair-trigger for cells fighting infection
items.summary: In response to infection the immune system produces unique antibodies to target each illness. To make these new antibodies, cells in the immune system must intentionally damage their own genes, meaning they run the risk of becoming cancer cells. New research reveals how a proteins called Tia1 acts as a hair-trigger for DNA repair, allowing the immune system to walk the line between health and harm.

alternate.title: A hair-trigger for cells fighting infection

items.title: A one-of-a-kind star found to change over decades
items.summary: Researchers recently found new evidence that lends support to an existing theory of how the unusual star emits energy.
